Package io.github.eutro.wasm2j.conf.api

Interface WirJavaConvention

public interface WirJavaConvention
Definitions for how certain WebAssembly concepts should be translated into Java.

When compiling a WebAssembly module, different functions, globals, memories, or tables may behave in different ways: some may be local to the compiled module, whereas others might be imported. We say each has its own convention: rules for calling, getting, setting, loading, storing, etc. These can be retrieved with the get* methods of this interface.

* A WirJavaConvention is typically created by a WirJavaConventionFactory * for compiling a given WebAssembly module, and encapsulates the conventions * of all the imported and local WebAssembly functions, globals, memories, and tables.

See Also:
  • FunctionConvention
  • GlobalConvention
  • MemoryConvention
  • TableConvention
  • DataConvention
  • ElemConvention
  • CallingConvention

    • convert

      void convert(IRPass<Function,Function> convertPass)
      Run the conversion of the WebAssembly module to a Java class. This should be called exactly once for each WirJavaConvention.
      Parameters:
      convertPass - The pass to convert a single WebAssembly-IR function to a Java-IR function.
